intro: Houstonia pusilla, commonly known as the small bluemink or dwarf blue-eyed Mary, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, small blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Houstonia pusilla has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of flowers that bloom in early spring. It is a low-growing perennial that thrives in partial shade and is often used in native plant gardens.
